title.narrative: Collaboration with Cotton Association of Zambia

description.narrative:
CAZ, a member-based organisation in the Zambian cotton sector, has been a client of Agriterra since 2009. The key challenge for CAZ is to become less dependent on donor funds. The CAZ Sustainability Index has been declining in the past 4 years and all parties agree that a drastic change is required to reverse this unhealthy situation. At the Organisational Change workshop held in January 2017, the decision was made to reprioritise the current key strategic objectives from the 2014-2018 Strategic Plan into the following new key strategic objectives:Resource Mobilisation Enhancing Membership (in number and fees)Development of Partnerships (CEEC, input suppliers, donors, etc.)Capacity buildingLobby and Advocacy (Cotton Act, favourable contracts for farmers)The overriding key strategic objective is Resource Mobilisation, which is to be supported by the other strategic objectives. Special attention should be given to resolving issues related to CAZ’s strategic venture of the farmer-owned Ginnery MFGPCo, a vehicle crucial for CAZ to enhance membership and increase own income.
